title: 820-01987  water damage.   No image
message:
Water damage around U1980.   Which is the PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 supply.
Had to replace this chip to get 2.5V rail back.   But what is scary is it's supply was PPBUS G3H.   So it is safe to assume that 12V hit the SSD line.  I replaced the IC and cleaned up the damage and this supply is back up.  

Now the unit appears to boot but will not display a image.   I don't see any hot spots so I am pretty sure the water damage is repaired.   Would it be safe to assume the SSSD's are toast?

Is this repairable?

title: 820-01987  water damage.   No image
message:
T2 has its partition on SSD.
Try DFU mode, to see if T2 can access its partition.

title: 820-01987  water damage.   No image
message: If the NAND is toast can it be replaced and DFU restored?

title: 820-01987  water damage.   No image
message:
Mission impossible almost...
NAND isn't underfilled?

title: 820-01987  water damage.   No image
message: Has anyone done it?  I saved the LB with the touch sensor.   Don't want to turn it into a donor just yet.
